4-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 4. Ensure equitable, inclusive and quality education and lifelong learning opportunities for all
4-1-1.SDG_TARGET: 4.1 By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, quality primary and secondary education on an equal basis, providing them with meaningful learning
4-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Ratio between the number of pupils enrolled in a level of education, having the official schooling age at that level and the total population of official schooling age at that level.
4-1-1.SOURCE_TYPE: Bureau of Educational Planning and Statistics, Statistical Yearbook
4-1-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from surveys of schools using the Questionnaire
4-1-1.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
4-1-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the educational situation in Burundi.
4-1-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a survey of schools in the territory of Burundi. The reluctance is noted for private establishments.
4-1-1.DATA_COMP: (The number of students enrolled in a given level of education, having the official school age at that level divided by the total official school age population at that level) multiplied by 100.
4-1-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
4-1-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level.
4-1-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

4-4-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 4. Ensure equitable, inclusive and quality education and lifelong learning opportunities for all
4-4-1.SDG_TARGET: 4.4 By 2030, significantly increase the number of young people and adults with the skills, including technical and vocational skills, necessary for employment, decent work and entrepreneurship
4-4-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 4.4.1. % of 6th year leavers enrolled in CEMs (public and private)
4-4-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Proportion of students entering vocational training centers compared to all students having completed 6 th
4-4-1.DATA_COMP: Ratio between students entering Trades Education Centers and all students having completed 6th grade, multiplied by 100.

4-a-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 4. Ensure equitable, inclusive and quality education and lifelong learning opportunities for all
4-a-1.SDG_TARGET: 4.a Build or adapt existing schools that are child, disabled and gender-friendly and provide a safe, non-violent, inclusive and effective learning environment for all
4-a-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 4.a.1.Proportion of schools with access to: a) electricity; b) the Internet for educational purposes; c) computers for educational purposes; d) infrastructure and materials adapted to disabled pupils; e) a basic supply of potable water;
4-a-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the ratio between the number of establishments with a given infrastructure and the total number of establishments.
4-a-1.SOURCE_TYPE: Bureau of Educational Planning and Statistics, Statistical Yearbook
4-a-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from surveys of schools using the Questionnaire
4-a-1.INST_MANDATE: The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
4-a-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the educational situation in Burundi.
4-a-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a survey of schools in the territory of Burundi. The reluctance is noted for private establishments.
4-a-1.DATA_COMP: Number of establishments with a given infrastructure divided by the total number of establishments, multiplied by 100
4-a-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
4-a-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level and by cycle. ([Drinking water: Preschool, Basic, General and educational post-basic, Technical post-basic]; [Electricity: Preschool, Basic, General and educational post-basic, Technical post-basic])
4-a-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

5-1-2.SDG_GOAL: Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
5-1-2.SDG_TARGET: 5.1 End all forms of discrimination against women and girls everywhere
5-1-2.SDG_INDICATOR: 5.1.2. % of seats held by women in the national parliament
5-1-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the ratio between the number of seats occupied by women and the total number of seats in Parliament and Senate
5-1-2.SOURCE_TYPE: Website of the National Assembly and the Senate
5-1-2.COLL_METHOD: Consultation of the Assembly and Senet website
5-1-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the texts and laws passed;
5-1-2.REC_USE_LIM: The update of the indicator results from the site feed
5-1-2.DATA_COMP: It is the number of seats held by women out of the total number of seats in Parliament and Senate, multiplied by 100

5-2-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
5-2-1.SDG_TARGET: 5.2 Eliminate from public and private life all forms of violence against women and girls, including trafficking and sexual exploitation and other types of exploitation
5-2-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 5.2.1 Proportion of women and girls aged 15 and over who have lived as a couple victims of physical or sexual violence during the previous 12 months
5-2-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
5-2-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Service and Focal Point
5-2-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the ratio between women and girls aged 15 and over who have lived as a couple victims of physical or sexual violence during the previous 12 months and all women and girls aged 15 and over.
5-2-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
5-2-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
5-2-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
5-2-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
5-2-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it captures the situation of violence against women.
5-2-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
5-2-1.DATA_COMP: Women and girls aged 15 and over who have lived in a relationship who have experienced physical or sexual violence in the past 12 months divided by the total of all women and girls aged 15 and over multiplied by 100.
5-2-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
5-2-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
5-2-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
5-2-1.OTHER_DOC: Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

6-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 6. Guarantee access for all to sustainably managed water supply and sanitation services
6-1-1.SDG_TARGET: 6.1 By 2030, ensure universal and equitable access to drinking water at an affordable cost
6-1-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 6.1.1. Drinking water coverage rate (%): Urban environment Rural environment
6-1-1.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
6-1-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring Service "SESSSP"
6-1-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of the Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring department
6-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the percentage between the number of households (or of the population) obtaining water from facilities deemed capable of supplying drinking water (connections to the running water distribution network, standpipes, boreholes equipped with pump, gravity water supply or rural pumping) and the total number of households (or the total population) at the national level.
6-1-1.SOURCE_TYPE: ISTEEBU, Survey on the living conditions of Burundian households (ECVMB) 2013-2014
6-1-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
6-1-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
6-1-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
6-1-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
6-1-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of coverage of the population with drinking water, an essential element for social well-being, in this case good health.
6-1-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
6-1-1.DATA_COMP: Ratio between the number of households (or the population) obtaining water from facilities deemed capable of supplying drinking water (connections to the running water distribution network, standpipes, boreholes fitted with motorized pumps human, gravity water supply or pumping in rural areas) and the total number of households (or the total population) at the national level, expressed as a percentage at the national level
6-1-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
6-1-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
6-1-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
6-1-1.OTHER_DOC: Household Survey Report, archives of the Ministry of Water, Energy and Mines (REGIDESO and AHAMR)

6-1-2.SDG_GOAL: Objective 6. Guarantee access for all to sustainably managed water supply and sanitation services
6-1-2.SDG_TARGET: 6.1 By 2030, ensure universal and equitable access to drinking water at an affordable cost
6-1-2.SDG_INDICATOR: 6.1.2. Number of households supplied with drinking water by private connection
6-1-2.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU) / REGIDESO
6-1-2.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring Service "SESSSP" / MHEM statistics and planning service
6-1-2.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of the Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring service / SDG focal point at MHEM
6-1-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: Number of households with access to a drinking water supply source (private connection, improved source or borehole)
6-1-2.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire or by using the administrative database of the Ministry of Water, Energy and Mines (REGIDESO).
6-1-2.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
6-1-2.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level or for conducting household surveys allowing the indicator to be calculated
6-1-2.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
6-1-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of coverage of the population with drinking water, an essential element for social well-being, in this case good health.
6-1-2.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator most often requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
6-1-2.DATA_COMP: Sum of all households with access to a source of drinking water supply in the area considered
6-1-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication. Administrative data are validated by the technical committee for statistical information (CTIS)
6-1-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
6-1-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
6-1-2.OTHER_DOC: Household Survey Report, archives of the Ministry of Water, Energy and Mines (REGIDESO and AHAMR)

6-1-3.SDG_GOAL: Objective 6. Guarantee access for all to sustainably managed water supply and sanitation services
6-1-3.SDG_TARGET: 6.1 By 2030, ensure universal and equitable access to drinking water at an affordable cost
6-1-3.SDG_INDICATOR: 6.1.3. Proportion of the population with sustainable access to an improved water source
6-1-3.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU) / REGIDESO
6-1-3.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring Service "SESSSP" / MHEM statistics and planning service
6-1-3.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of the Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring service / SDG focal point at MHEM
6-1-3.STAT_CONC_DEF: it is the percentage of the population living in ordinary households whose households are connected to a sewage disposal system compared to all ordinary households
6-1-3.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire or by using the administrative database of the Ministry of Water, Energy and Mines (REGIDESO).
6-1-3.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021
6-1-3.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level or for conducting household surveys allowing the indicator to be calculated
6-1-3.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
6-1-3.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of coverage of the population with drinking water, an essential element for social well-being, in this case good health.
6-1-3.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator most often requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
6-1-3.DATA_COMP: Ratio between the developed connected to an improved water source and the total number of ordinary households, expressed as a percentage
6-1-3.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication. Administrative data are validated by the technical committee for statistical information (CTIS)
6-1-3.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at the national level and by area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
6-1-3.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
6-1-3.OTHER_DOC: Household Survey Report, archives of the Ministry of Water, Energy and Mines (REGIDESO and AHAMR)

6-2-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 6. Guarantee access for all to sustainably managed water supply and sanitation services
6-2-1.SDG_TARGET: 6.2 By 2030, ensure access for all, under equitable conditions, to adequate sanitation and hygiene services and end open defecation, paying special attention to the needs of women and girls and people in vulnerable situations
6-2-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 6.2.1. % of the population with access to adequate sanitation
6-2-1.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU) / REGIDESO
6-2-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring Service "SESSSP" / MHEM statistics and planning service
6-2-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring service / SDG focal point at MHEM
6-2-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the percentage of the population with access to improved sanitation facilities. These improved facilities include flush toilets with septic tanks, traditional improved or ventilated latrines, and sewage-connected latrines. The excreta treatment system is considered adequate if it is private (not shared) and if it prevents human contact with human excrement
6-2-1.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the household questionnaire
6-2-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
6-2-1.DATA_SOURCE: ISTEEBU / Ministry of Hydraulics, Energy and Mines
6-2-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
6-2-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
6-2-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of coverage of the population in terms of sanitation, an essential element for social well-being, in this case good health.
6-2-1.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator most often requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
6-2-1.DATA_COMP: Ratio of ordinary households connected to a sump, ditch, main collector and soak-off well and all ordinary households, expressed as a percentage
6-2-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication. Administrative data are validated by the technical committee for statistical information (CTIS)
6-2-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
6-2-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
6-2-1.OTHER_DOC: Annual report of the Ministry of Water, Energy and Mines.

6-2-2.SDG_GOAL: Objective 6. Guarantee access for all to sustainably managed water supply and sanitation services
6-2-2.SDG_TARGET: 6.2 By 2030, ensure access for all, under equitable conditions, to adequate sanitation and hygiene services and end open defecation, paying special attention to the needs of women and girls and people in vulnerable situations
6-2-2.SDG_INDICATOR: 6.2.2. Percentage of households with a suitable toilet (toilet with toilet bowl and private outdoor toilet)
6-2-2.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
6-2-2.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring Service "SESSSP"
6-2-2.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of the Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring department
6-2-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the percentage of the population with access to improved sanitation facilities. These improved facilities include flush toilets with septic tanks, traditional improved or ventilated latrines, and sewage-connected latrines. The excreta treatment system is considered adequate if it is private (not shared) and if it prevents human contact with human excrement
6-2-2.COLL_METHOD: Data are collected from household surveys using the household questionnaire
6-2-2.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
6-2-2.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
6-2-2.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
6-2-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of coverage of the population in terms of hygiene, an essential element for social well-being, in this case good health.
6-2-2.REC_USE_LIM: Updating the indicator most often requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
6-2-2.DATA_COMP: Ratio between ordinary households with a suitable toilet, i.e. WC with flushing water and private WC and all ordinary households
6-2-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication.
6-2-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
6-2-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

6-b-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 6. Guarantee access for all to sustainably managed water supply and sanitation services
6-b-1.SDG_TARGET: 6.b Support and strengthen the participation of the local population in improving water and sanitation management
6-b-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 6.b.1.Proportion of local governments that have operational policies and procedures in place that encourage the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management
6-b-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Workforce of local administrations with policies and operational procedures in place encouraging the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management in relation to the total workforce
6-b-1.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected daily from the MHEM
6-b-1.COMPILING_ORG: The MHEM statistical service is responsible for compiling the data for the calculation of this indicator at the national level.
6-b-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
6-b-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reports on the level of adherence of local administrations to operational policies and procedures encouraging the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management
6-b-1.REC_USE_LIM: The increase in this proportion will be conditioned by an increased awareness of local administrations
6-b-1.DATA_COMP: Workforce of local administrations that have policies and operational procedures in place to encourage the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management in relation to the total workforce
6-b-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Administrative data are validated by the technical committee for statistical information (CTIS)
6-b-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
6-b-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
6-b-1.OTHER_DOC: Annual report of the Ministry of Hydraulics, Energy and Mines (REGIDESO and AHAMR)

7-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 7. Guarantee access for all to reliable, sustainable and modern energy services at an affordable cost
7-1-1.SDG_TARGET: 7.1 By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services
7-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: The access rate corresponds to the ratio between the population served and the total population, which is expressed as a percentage
7-1-1.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2021
7-1-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
7-1-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
7-1-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of electricity coverage
7-1-1.REC_USE_LIM: The numerator may not be exhaustive because some households supplied with electricity are not registered with REGIDESO. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
7-1-1.DATA_COMP: Ratio of the population that can be connected to electricity and the total population, expressed as a percentage
7-1-1.DATA_VALIDATION: The survey results data are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication.
7-1-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available nationally and by area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
7-1-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

7-1-2.SDG_GOAL: Objective 7. Guarantee access for all to reliable, sustainable and modern energy services at an affordable cost
7-1-2.SDG_TARGET: 7.1 By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services
7-1-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: This is the number of urban households subscribing to REGIDESO
7-1-2.COLL_METHOD: Centralized database operation, collection is done daily
7-1-2.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
7-1-2.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
7-1-2.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
7-1-2.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of electricity coverage
7-1-2.REC_USE_LIM: The numerator may not be exhaustive because some households supplied with electricity are not registered with REGIDESO. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
7-1-2.DATA_COMP: This indicator is given by the sum of households subscribing to REGIDESO
7-1-2.DATA_VALIDATION: The survey results data are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication.
7-1-2.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
7-1-2.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

7-1-3.SDG_GOAL: Objective 7. Guarantee access for all to reliable, sustainable and modern energy services at an affordable cost
7-1-3.SDG_TARGET: 7.1 By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services
7-1-3.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the quantity of electricity available to the country, consisting of electricity produced locally and imported. This quantity can be used locally or exported
7-1-3.COLL_METHOD: Centralized database operation, collection is done daily
7-1-3.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
7-1-3.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
7-1-3.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
7-1-3.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of electricity coverage
7-1-3.REC_USE_LIM: The numerator may not be exhaustive because some households supplied with electricity are not registered with REGIDESO. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
7-1-3.DATA_COMP: The indicator is given by the sum of GWH produced locally and GWH imported
7-1-3.DATA_VALIDATION: Data from administrative sources are most often validated by the Technical Committee for Statistical Information (CTIS).
7-1-3.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
7-1-3.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

7-1-4.SDG_GOAL: Objective 7. Guarantee access for all to reliable, sustainable and modern energy services at an affordable cost
7-1-4.SDG_TARGET: 7.1 By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services
7-1-4.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the total gross electricity production (as opposed to the net production) which is the total amount of electrical energy produced nationally expressed in GWH.
7-1-4.COLL_METHOD: Centralized database operation, collection is done daily
7-1-4.FREQ_COLL: The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
7-1-4.COMPILING_ORG: The compilation of data for the calculation of this indicator is made by the statistical and planning service of the ministry.
7-1-4.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
7-1-4.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the increase in electricity production as a function of population growth
7-1-4.REC_USE_LIM: It is necessary to calculate the loss of electrical energy
7-1-4.DATA_COMP: Sum of electricity production during a given period
7-1-4.DATA_VALIDATION: Data from administrative sources are most often validated by the Technical Committee for Statistical Information (CTIS).
7-1-4.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
7-1-4.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

7-1-5.SDG_GOAL: Objective 7. Guarantee access for all to reliable, sustainable and modern energy services at an affordable cost
7-1-5.SDG_TARGET: 7.1 By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services
7-1-5.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the total quantity of electrical energy delivered to customers and billed, whether nationally or outside the country, it is expressed in GWH sold.
7-1-5.COLL_METHOD: Centralized database operation, collection is done daily
7-1-5.COMPILING_ORG: The compilation of data for the calculation of this indicator is done by the statistics and planning service of the MHEM.
7-1-5.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination, after validation, of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
7-1-5.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the quantity of electricity sold
7-1-5.REC_USE_LIM: It is interesting to know if all the electricity production is sold and what is the proportion of the revenues coming from this sale.
7-1-5.DATA_COMP: Sum of the total amount of electrical energy delivered to customers and billed
7-1-5.DATA_VALIDATION: Data from administrative sources are most often validated by the Technical Committee for Statistical Information (CTIS).
7-1-5.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
7-1-5.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
7-1-5.OTHER_DOC: REGIDESO and ABER annual report / MINHEM statistical yearbook

8-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 8. Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
8-1-1.SDG_TARGET: 8.1 Maintain an economic growth rate per capita adapted to the national context and, in particular, an annual growth rate of the gross domestic product of at least 7% in the least developed countries
8-1-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 8.1.1. Annual growth rate of real GDP
8-1-1.CONTACT_ORGANISATION: Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
8-1-1.ORGANISATION_UNIT: Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring Service "SESSSP"
8-1-1.CONTACT_FUNCT: Head of the Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring department
8-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: It is the percentage change in real GDP in year n compared to real GDP in year n-1
8-1-1.SOURCE_TYPE: Data is collected from administrative sources
8-1-1.COLL_METHOD: The growth rate of real GDP is evaluated by the prices of the base year and the volume production of the years considered.
8-1-1.COMPILING_ORG: ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling the data allowing the calculation of this indicator at the national level
8-1-1.INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination, after validation, of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making
8-1-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of development of the country
8-1-1.REC_USE_LIM: It is interesting to do an analysis of GDP growth over a long period in order to see the general trend.
8-1-1.DATA_COMP: [(Real GDP n-real GDP n-1) / real GDP n-1] * 100
8-1-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Data from administrative sources are most often validated by the Technical Committee for Statistical Information (CTIS).
8-1-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
8-1-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

9-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Objective 9. Build a resilient infrastructure, promote sustainable industrialization that benefits everyone and encourage innovation
9-1-1.SDG_TARGET: 9.1 Establish quality, reliable, sustainable and resilient infrastructure, including regional and cross-border infrastructure, to promote economic development and human well-being, prioritizing universal, affordable and equitable access
9-1-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 9.1.1. Proportion of the road network passable in all seasons (asphalted + classified) (%)
9-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Percentage of the asphalted road network classified as passable all year round compared to the entire length of this network
9-1-1.COLL_METHOD: Data is collected from administrative sources
9-1-1.COMPILING_ORG: The compilation of the data for the calculation of this indicator is made by the statistics and planning service of the MTTPEAT
9-1-1.INST_MANDATE: The statistics and planning departments of the ministries are responsible for compiling data from their ministries for the calculation of indicators at the national level.
9-1-1.RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reflects the condition of the roads
9-1-1.REC_USE_LIM: It is interesting to know the durability of asphalt roads
9-1-1.DATA_COMP: The indicator is calculated as the ratio between the length of the paved road network and classified as passable all year round compared to the entire length of this network, expressed as a percentage.
9-1-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Data from administrative sources are most often validated by the Technical Committee for Statistical Information (CTIS), after internal validation.
9-1-1.COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
9-1-1.COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

LIndice Ibrahim de la gouvernance en Afrique (IIAG) est un outil de mesure et de suivi des performances en matire de gouvernance dans les pays africains. La Fondation Mo Ibrahim dfinit la gouvernance comme laccs  des biens et  des services publics, dans les domaines politique, social et conomique auxquels chaque citoyen peut lgitimement prtendre auprs de son tat et que tout tat est tenu doffrir  ses concitoyens  Dans le cadre de lIIAG, les performances dun pays en matire de gouvernance sont mesures  partir de quatre composantes: : Scurit et tat de droit, Participation et Droits humains,
Dveloppement conomique durable et Dveloppement humain.

2-2-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: La malnutrition aigu est une forme de sous-nutrition. Elle est cause par une baisse dans la consommation de nourriture et/ou une maladie associes causant des dmes bilatraux et/ou une perte de poids soudaine. Sa forme svre est caractrise par la prsence doedmes bilatraux ou de lmaciation (faible z-score de poids-pour-taille ou faible primtre brachial). On y distingue la Malnutrition Aige Globale (MAG) qui est la somme de la Malnutrition Aige Modre (MAM) et de la Malnutrition Aige Svre (MAS).

3-3-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Le taux de prvelence du VIH/SIDA(15-49 ans) est la proportion de la population de 15  49 ans teste positive au VIH/SIDA par rapport  la population total de 15  49 ans
3-3-1.COLL_METHOD: Les donnes sont collectes  partir des registres administratifs des formations sanitaires
3-3-1.INST_MANDATE: Les dpartements Ministriels sont les membres du SSN ayant comme mission de collecter, traiter et diffuser les donnes de leur secteur
3-3-1.RATIONALE: Lindicateur est pertinent car il rend compte de la situation sanitaire au Burundi.
3-3-1.REC_USE_LIM: La mise  jour de lindicateur ncessite une collecte exhaustive dans les formations sanitaires . Pour le plupart des donnes les donnes des formations sanitaires prives ne sont pas prises en compte.
3-3-1.DATA_COMP: Rapport entre la population de 15  49 ans teste positive au VIH/SIDA et la population totale de 15  49 ans multiplie par 100
3-3-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Les rsultats de la collecte sont valids  deux niveaux : validation interne et validation au niveau du CTIS avant la publication
3-3-1.COVERAGE: L'indicateur est disponible au niveau national et par sexe. (Total; Femmes; Hommes)
3-3-1.COMPARABILITY: Lindicateur peut tre compar aux autres indicateurs du mme type au niveau rgional et international

6-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: C'est le pourcentage entre le nombre de mnages (ou de la population) se procurant de l'eau dans les installations juges capables de fournir de l'eau potable (branchements au rseau de distribution d'eau courante, bornes fontaines, forages munis de pompe  motricit humaine, adduction d'eau gravitaire ou pompage en milieu rural) et le nombre total de mnages (ou la population totale) au niveau national.
6-1-1.SOURCE_TYPE: ISTEEBU, Enqute sur les conditions de vie des mnages burundais (ECVMB) 2013-2014
6-1-1.COLL_METHOD: Les donnes sont collectes  partir des enqutes auprs des mnages  laide du questionnaire  mnage

6-1-1.INST_MANDATE: LISTEEBU est lorgane reconnu par le gouvernement burundais pour la collecte, le traitement et la diffusion des statistiques officielles aidant dans la planification et la prise de dcision.
6-1-1.RATIONALE: Lindicateur est pertinent car il rend compte du niveau de couverture de la population en eau potable, lment indispensable pour le bien-tre social,  loccurrence la bonne sant.
6-1-1.REC_USE_LIM: La mise  jour de lindicateur ncessite une enqute auprs des mnages qui exige beaucoup de moyens. Lindicateur ne pas tre calcul par sexe.
6-1-1.DATA_COMP: Rapport entre le nombre de mnages (ou de la population) se procurant de l'eau dans les installations juges capables de fournir de l'eau potable (branchements au rseau de distribution d'eau courante, bornes fontaines, forages munis de pompe  motricit humaine, adduction d'eau gravitaire ou pompage en milieu rural) et le nombre total de mnages (ou la population totale) au niveau national, exprim en pourcentage au niveau national
6-1-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Les rsultats de lenqute sont valids  deux niveaux : validation technique et validation officielle avant la publication
6-1-1.COVERAGE: L'indicateur est disponible au niveau national, province, Milieu de rsidence  (Total; Milieu urbain; Milieu rural)
6-1-1.COMPARABILITY: Lindicateur peut tre compar aux autres indicateurs du mme type au niveau rgional et international

6-a-1.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 6. Garantir laccs de tous  des services dalimentation en eau et dassainissement grs de faon durable
6-a-1.SDG_TARGET: 6.a Dici  2030, dvelopper la coopration internationale et lappui au renforcement des capacits des pays en dveloppement en ce qui concerne les activits et programmes relatifs  leau et  lassainissement, y compris la collecte, la dsalinisation et lutilisation rationnelle de leau, le traitement des eaux uses, le recyclage et les techniques de rutilisation
6-a-1.SDG_INDICATOR: 6.a.1 Montant de laide publique au dveloppement consacre  leau et  lassainissement dans un plan de dpenses coordonn par les pouvoirs publics
6-a-1.STAT_CONC_DEF:
Laide publique au dveloppement (APD) est dfinie comme les flux de financement public administrs avec la promotion du dveloppement conomique et du bien-tre des pays en dveloppement comme objectif principal, et qui ont un caractre concessionnel avec un lment de subvention dau moins 25% (en utilisant un taux fixe de remise de 10 pour cent). Par convention, les flux dAPD comprennent les contributions
des organismes gouvernementaux donateurs,  tous les niveaux, aux pays en dveloppement (APD bilatrale) et aux institutions multilatrales.
6-a-1.SOURCE_TYPE: Ministre des Finances, du Budget et de la Coopration au Dveloppement
6-a-1.COLL_METHOD: Les donnes sont collectes  partir des documents administratifs
6-a-1.INST_MANDATE: Les dpartements Ministriels sont les membres du SSN ayant comme mission de collecter, traiter et diffuser les donnes de leur secteur
6-a-1.RATIONALE: Lindicateur est pertinent car il rend compte de la proportion d'aide publique au dveloppement consacre  l'assainissement et l'eau.
6-a-1.REC_USE_LIM: La mise  jour de lindicateur ncessite une collecte exhaustive de toutes aides aides publiques au dveloppement, consacres  l'eau et l'assainissement
6-a-1.DATA_VALIDATION: Les donnes sont valides  deux niveaux : validation interne et validation au niveau du CTIS avant la publication
6-a-1.COVERAGE: L'indicateur est disponible au niveau national.
6-a-1.COMPARABILITY: Les donnes peuvent tre compares aux donnes antrieures
6-a-1.OTHER_DOC: Rapport sur l'utilisation des aides publiques au dveloppement
